DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Nausea 1 Frequency Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the frequency of nausea, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Nausea 1 Frequency Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about how much nausea an individual experienced during the specified time period._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Nausea 1 Frequency Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (I seldom if ever have nausea) to 5 (I have nausea continually) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I seldom if ever have nausea

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I seldom if ever have nausea
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual seldom, if ever, has or had nausea.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual seldom, if ever, has or had nausea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea continually.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea continually.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I have nausea half the time at least

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I have nausea half the time at least
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea half the time at least.

Concepts.longName: Have Nausea at Least Half the Time
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea half the time at least.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea fairly often.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea fairly often.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I have nausea once in a while

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I have nausea once in a while
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea once in a while.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had nausea once in a while.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
